name: Dropbox Social Impact Projects
tagline: Lend your skills to projects with social impact
body:
## Hey Dropbox, thanks
Thanks for taking time to work on some important civic engagement and social justice projects! They will impact the city of Cleveland, Ohio and in the future, whatever city would like to replicate the projects. Your time is appreciated above measure.

***

## Clarity
These projects came out of the [FIX 216 Civic Hackathon](http://www.hackcleveland.org/events/2015/3/28/fix-216) and we've had a couple follow up meetings since the event to make sure all information is up-to-date and organized. If anything is unclear or if you have a question, ask us! Email seth@hackcleveland.org

***
_Projects are in order of priority_   

[_Main data source is City of Cleveland Website_](http://www.city.cleveland.oh.us/)     

> ## Project #1
> ### ISSUE/PUBLIC MEETING ALERT APP AND SEARCH SYSTEM 
>An Alert Opt in service built to attract interested, but busy residents with cell phone or email alerts re: public meetings, a specific issue or major news interest; user-defined geography, keyword  

>Data source: City/County Council, board, or committee agendas, minutes, and calendars (currently buried in pdfs on each website â€“ no way to find out other than visiting every day, knowing the URLs).  

> ## How You Can Contribute
> Build a data scraper to get information out of PDFs
> ## Project Files
> [Project Notes](https://hackpad.com/Development-Notification-AHkIHW53n13)    

> [Live Example](https://www.citygram.nyc/)   
  
>[Code for America-Github](https://github.com/codeforamerica/citygram)

***
> ## Project #2  
> ### GOVERNMENT MEETING MINUTE ANALYSIS
> System to analyze meeting minutes currently locked in PDFz (currently for Cuyahoga County Council committees and subcommittees)  

> At-a-glance users are able to identify if there were any absences and if there was an opportunity for public comment (indicated with Xs and check marks); relevant motions, which members were absent.
> ## How You Can Contribute
> Mine data in order to expand current data set from all of Cuyahoga County to City of Cleveland so users can filter results by city
> ## Project Files
> [Cuyahoga Meeting Minutes Statistics-Github](https://github.com/Buckeyes216/fix216)

***
> ## Project #3
> ### PUBLIC SERVANT INTERACTION API   
>Database to track points of interface between the public and public servants (police, prosecutors, elected officials, building inspectors, etc.)  

> Valuable resource for future app development; data is also customizable for maps, infographics, and reports. Could lead to ACLU-type app or Yelp for the police app.
> ## How You Can Contribute
> Create a landing page that links to the open source project and provides content that explains to city leadership the meaning and value of using APIs
> ## Project Files
> [Interactions-Github](https://github.com/PermanentRecord-Fix216)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
